qas.question: Can i travel between us and mexico?

answers.text: the land border between the US and Mexico reopened on 8 November for travellers going to the US who have been vaccinated with WHO approved COVID vaccines.

qas.question: Do i need to fill any forms when i land in mexico?

answers.text: Upon your arrival in Mexico, you will be asked to fill out a Health Questionnaire.

paragraphs.context: Following the earlier closure to all non-essential traffic as part of COVID-19 measures, the land border between the US and Mexico reopened on 8 November for travellers going to the US who have been vaccinated with WHO approved COVID vaccines. The closure will still be in effect for non-vaccinated travellers and applies primarily to tourism and recreational travel. Cargo, trade and healthcare workers will still be able to cross the border. Check with your closest US Embassy/Consulate before attempting to cross the border. If you present symptoms of COVID-19 upon arrival at an airport in Mexico, you should ask for the International Health Team (â€œSanidad Internacionalâ€). Upon your arrival in Mexico, you will be asked to fill out a Health Questionnaire. This document is available in Spanish and English
